alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the southeastern City of Poquoson, the City of Norfolk, the northwestern City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth, the northeastern City of Suffolk, the City of Hampton and the southern City of Newport News through 345 PM EDT... At 255 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Western Branch, or near Churchland, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cradock around 300 PM EDT. Churchland and Downtown Portsmouth around 305 PM EDT. Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Norfolk State University, Portsmouth and Ghent around 310 PM EDT. Norfolk NAS, Norview and Norfolk International around 315 PM EDT. Ocean View, Hampton University, Norfolk and Fort Monroe around 320 PM EDT. Buckroe Beach around 325 PM EDT. Grand View around 330 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Wilroy, Fox Hill, Phoebus, Langley View, Wards Corner, Huntersville, Deanes, Willoughby Spit and Raleigh Terrace. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk
